methodology.name: Logic Programming
methodology.description: A programming paradigm based formal logic, representing knowledge as a set of facts and rules that define relationships among entities.

methodology.name: Rules-Based Systems
methodology.description: Systems that use "if-then" rules to derive decisions and actions from given facts and conditions.

methodology.name: Semantic Networks
methodology.description: Graph-based structures used to represents knowledge as a network of relationships, with knowledge as nodes and concepts as edges, representing relationships.

methodology.name: Knowledge Representation
methodology.description: A set of techniques used to formalize and structure knowledge in way that can be used by machines for reasoning.

method.name: Forward Chaining
method.description: Data-driven approaches to reasoning that start from known facts and apply inference rules to derive new facts and conclusions until a goal is reached.

method.name: Backward Chaining
method.description: Approaches to reasoning that start with a desired goal and work backwards through logical rules to determine which facts must be true to support it.

method.name: A* Search
method.description: An optimization algorithm that finds the best route to a goal by balancing the cost so far using heuristics to guide the search and make decisions efficiently.

method.name: Depth-First/Best-First Search
method.description: Approaches for exploring decision spaces systematically traversing or searching through tree or graph data structures, each employing a distinct strategy to explore nodes.

method.name: Resolution Theorem Proving
method.description: Procedures that apply logical inference rules to systematically derive conclusions from a set of premises by resolving contradictions in logic.

method.name: Constraint Satisfaction Problems
method.description: The process of finding solutions that meet all specified constraints within a given problem space.

method.name: MiniMax Algorithm
method.description: A strategy for decision-making for adversarial games by that helps pick the best move by minimizing loss and maximizing gain.

method.name: Dynamic Programming
method.description: A technique that solves complex problems by breaking them into simpler parts, and using solutions in a recursive way to reduce computations and time.

method.name: Knowledge Graph Methods
method.description: Methods that organize and connect information to help systems navigate, query and update facts to derive information from the connected nodes.

remove.name: Semantic Network Traversal
remove.description: Approaches that navigate relationships within a semantic network to help understand interconnections and infer new knowledge or answer queries.

remove.name: Knowledge Graph Methods
remove.description: Approaches to organizing and analyzing structure data through graphs of entities and their relationships, enabling reasoning and inference.

application.name: Expert Systems
application.description: Programs that use rule-based reasoning to simulate human decision-making in specialized domains.

application.name: Semantic Web
application.description: An extension of the World Wide Web that enables machines to interpret and process data with semantic meaning.

application.name: Symbolic Mathematics
application.description: Techniques to manipulate mathematical expressions symbolically rather than numerically, enabling exact computation.

application.name: Ontologies
application.description: Structured representations of knowledge that define the concepts, relationships and constraints for a given domain.

application.name: Automated Theorem Provers
application.description: Programs that use formal logic to automatically prove or discover mathematical and logical theorems.

application.name: Automated Reasoning Systems
application.description: Systems designed to infer new knowledge and make logical deductions based on known facts and rules.

methodology.name: Markov Models
methodology.description: Probabilistic models that assume the future state depends only on the current state, commonly used for sequential data analysis.

methodology.name: Statistical Inference
methodology.description: The processes and techniques used to draw conclusions about population or process parameters based on sample data and probabilistic reasoning.

methodology.name: Probability Theory
methodology.description: The broad foundational mathematical framework tools used in many fields to model uncertainty and randomness, and analyze data distributions.

methodology.name: Bayesian Network
methodology.description: Graphical models that represent probabilistic relationships among variables, enabling inference under uncertainty.

methodology.name: Supervised Learning
methodology.description: A machine learning approach that uses labeled data to train models to make predictions on unlabeled data.

methodology.name: Unsupervised Learning
methodology.description: A machine learning approach that finds underlying patterns and groupings in data without labels.

methodology.name: Reinforcement Learning
methodology.description: A learning paradigm where an agent learns optimal actions by interacting with an environment and receiving feedback in the form of rewards or penalties to guide its actions.

method.name: Evolutionary Algorithms
method.description: A set of techniques inspired by natural selection, where solutions evolved over generations through operations like mutation, crossover & selection.

method.name: K-Means Clustering
method.description: An unsupervised machine learning method groups data points into a chosen number of clusters by finding the best “centers” for each group.

method.name: Genetic Programming
method.description: A technique that uses “survival of the fittest” to automatically evolve computer programs to solve problems.

method.name: Hierarchical Clustering
method.description: An unsupervised machine learning method for clustering data by that builds nested groups by merging or splitting data.

method.name: Markov Chain
method.description: An approach to modeling a dynamic system where the probability of next state depends solely on the current state.

method.name: Belief Propagation
method.description: An iterative message-passing algorithm used to perform inference on graphical models by passing messages, where messages encode a local “’beliefs” about the neighbouring variables, enabling efficient computation of marginal distributions (approximate margninals in the case of “loopy graphs”).

method.name: Hypothesis Testing
method.description: A statistical method for assessing assumptions about a population using sample data.

method.name: Expectation Maximization
method.description: An iterative algorithm for finding maximum likelihood estimates in models with latent variables.

method.name: Policy Gradient Methods
method.description: Reinforcement learning algorithms that update the parameters of policy by estimating the gradients towards maximizing cumulative rewards.

method.name: Q-Learning
method.description: A reinforcement learning algorithm that learns the value of actions in states to maximize long-term reward.

method.name: Proximal Policy Optimization
method.description: A reinforcement learning algorithm that improves policies by limiting changes using clipped object functions.

method.name: Logistic Regression
method.description: A statistical machine learning method used for binary classification that predicts the probability of class membership using a logistic function.

method.name: Principal Component Analysis
method.description: A dimensionality reduction technique that projects data onto orthogonal directions that capture the most variance.

method.name: Support Vector Machine
method.description: A supervised learning algorithm that finds the optimal hyperplane to separate classes in a high-dimensional space.

method.name: Random Forest
method.description: An ensemble learning method that builds multiple decision trees using different subsets of data and features, and combines their outputs, improving generalizability and robustness.

method.name: Linear Regression
method.description: A statistical method that models the linear relationship between input features and a continuous target variable.

application.name: Game playing
application.description: Systems designed to play and optimize strategies in games using decision-making algorithms.

application.name: Risk Assessment
application.description: Models that predict probabilities of adverse outcomes using statistical and machine learning techniques.

application.name: Drug Effectiveness
application.description: The evaluation of the therapeutic potential of pharmaceutical compounds and the probability of adverse reactions using statistical and AI methods.

application.name: Survival Analysis
application.description: The use of use of statistical models that predict time-to-event outcomes, such as failures, disease, death etc., using censored data.

application.name: Robotics
application.description: Systems, typically with mechanical components, that use AI to execute tasks autonomously through perception, planning and control.

application.name: Image Compression
application.description: The use of statistical and machine learning algorithms to reduce the file size of an image with minimizing degradation and preserving key visual features.

application.name: Speech Recognition
application.description: The machine learning task of converting spoken language into text using linguistic and acoustic modeling.

application.name: Image Classification
application.description: The supervised machine learning task of assigning labels to images based on visual content.

application.name: Text Classification
application.description: The supervised machine learning task of classifying text into predefined classes using natural language processing techniques.

application.name: Anomaly Detection
application.description: The machine learning task of identifying rare or unexpected patterns in data.

application.name: Remaining Useful Life
application.description: The statistical or machine learning task of predicting the time until a system or component fails.

application.name: Object Detection
application.description: The machine learning task of detecting and classifying multiple objects in an image or video.

application.name: Audio Classification
application.description: The machine learning task of categorizing audio clips into predefined classes.

application.name: Churn Prediction
application.description: The machine learning task of forecasting the likelihood of customers canceling or discontinuing a service subscription.

methodology.name: Deep Learning
methodology.description: Neural networks with multiple layers, typically with non-linear activation functions, to learn representations of the data at multiple levels of abstraction.

methodology.name: Supervised Learning
methodology.description: A machine learning approach that uses labeled data to train models to make predictions on unlabeled data.

methodology.name: Unsupervised Learning
methodology.description: A machine learning approach that finds underlying patterns and groupings in data without labels.

methodology.name: Artificial Neural Networks
methodology.description: Machine learning models loosely inspired by the human brain, built using layers of interconnected nodes.

architecture.name: Convolutional Neural Networks
architecture.description: A type of deep neural network architecture designed for analyzing visual data using convolutional layers.

architecture.name: Recurrent Neural Networks
architecture.description: Neural networks designed for sequential data via feedback loops, where the outputs depend on current and previous inputs.

architecture.name: Generative Adversarial Networks
architecture.description: A method that uses two competing neural networks , a generator and a discriminator or evaluator, iteratively refining generated data to match real data distributions, producing realistic synthetic data.

architecture.name: Variational Autoencoders
architecture.description: Generative neural networks that learn probabilistic latent representations of input data, enabling generation by sampling and decoding from the latent space.

architecture.name: Transformer
architecture.description: A deep learning architecture that used an attention mechanism for parallelized processing of sequential data.

method.name: Backpropagation
method.description: An algorithm used to train neural networks by propagating error gradients from output back through the network.

method.name: Stochastic Gradient Descent
method.description: An optimization algorithm that updates model parameters using randomly selected mini-batches of data to approximate the true gradient.

method.name: Adam Optimizer
method.description: An adaptive learning-rate optimization algorithm combining RMSprop and momentum for efficient gradient-based training.

method.name: Attention Mechanism
method.description: A method to enable models to focus on relevant parts of the input by assigning importance scores to parts of the input.

application.name: Text-to-Speech
application.description: The machine learning task of synthesizing human sounding speech from written text.

application.name: Text Summarization
application.description: The machine learning task of reducing documents into coherent summaries while retaining key information.

application.name: Text-to-Video
application.description: The machine learning task of generating video based on textual descriptions.

application.name: Text Generation
application.description: The machine learning task of generating human-like text from prompts in natural language.

application.name: Text-to-Image
application.description: The machine learning task of generating images from textual descriptions.

application.name: Image-to-Text
application.description: The machine learning task of generating descriptive or contextual text from images.

application.name: Video-to-Text
application.description: The machine learning task of generating textual descriptions or transcripts from video content.
